{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3500495,"name":"Mohammad Wasim","username":"Mohammad1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/b5ac83/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T05:55:52.825Z","cooked":"

Hello, as my team has made great strides in developing a fully functional field centric swerve drive with the YAGSL library, thrifty v2 modules, neo vortexes, a pigeon 2, and CANCoders, we are experiencing a problem where our swerve frame will move normally for around thirty seconds before various spark flexes give a timed out warning and our modules are no longer oriented correctly. we are using the latest version of the yagsl example code which I will send tomorrow. Attached is a video showing how the orientation of the modules change after moving around, at the end we try driving straight one more time before rotating. We’ve checked our wiring and we’re confident in it, we are also using two sparkmaxes to control an arm but this problem has persisted since before we added that hardware, I’ve read in other posts that some people found success in reducing CAN Bus utilization but I’m not sure how to do this, any thoughts on what might be causing this issue? Thank you. Swerve Video

Check the inversion states.

Could you join the discord for more info.

docs.yagsl.com
